details.COBALT: A workload manager used for allocating resources and managing jobs on a cluster.
details.TensorFlow: An open-source machine learning framework used for developing and deploying machine learning models.
details.MPICH: A high-performance message passing interface (MPI) implementation used for parallel computing.
details.Darshan: A performance analysis tool used for collecting and analyzing I/O performance data.
details.Python: A general-purpose programming language used for developing the DLIO benchmark application.
details.CPU: The script utilizes a large number of cores (64) and threads (128) on the cluster.
details.GPU: The script does not explicitly mention GPU usage, but it may be optional depending on the DLIO benchmark configuration.
details.Memory: The script accesses data from a shared file system (/projects/datascience/dhari/dlio_datasets) suggesting a requirement for a substantial amount of memory.
details.Network: The script utilizes MPICH for communication between processes, indicating a reliance on high-speed network connectivity.
details.Storage: The script accesses data from a shared file system (/projects/datascience/dhari/dlio_datasets) and uses Darshsan to monitor I/O performance, signifying a need for reliable and high-throughput storage.
